page.title: 08Top Hall Farm-Thorpe Salvin
page.content: Sheet 1. { {Top Hall Farm}is a 131 acre{arable farm, and is part of a 3500 acre farming company spreading over four Counties. We have no animals at Top Hall, but have{Poultry, Sheep and Beef {Cattle}on our Derbyshire and Nottinghamshire Farms. The crops grown on the arable farms are{wheat, {barley, oats, peas, oilseed rape}and{ {potatoes.}In the farming year 1984-85 Top Hall is growing 40 acres of oilseed rape, 40 acres of winter barley and the remainder spring barley. Work starts at 7am and finishes at 5pm with two meal breaks at 9am and noon from Monday to Friday. All other time worked is overtime and this is quite a number of hours extra when crops are planted and harvested. { CONTINUED...
